meanings.definition: A light, hollow roll made from an egg batter similar to that of Yorkshire pudding.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious popover with my breakfast this morning.
meanings.sent2: The bakery down the street sells the best popovers in town.
meanings.sent3: As I took a bite of the popover, it seemed to float on my taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The popover was like a fluffy cloud on my plate.
meanings.sent5: The popover melted in my mouth, leaving a delightful taste behind.

meanings.definition: To appear or occur suddenly or unexpectedly.
meanings.sent1: Out of nowhere, a bright idea popped over in my mind.
meanings.sent2: The solution to the problem suddenly popover during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The answer seemed to popover out of thin air, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile popover on her face as she heard the good news.
meanings.sent5: The memory of that day always popovers in my mind when I least expect it.
